20101220150055.000|20101220150057.000|TR0|place tonight.  NASA says to be on the 
20101220150057.000|20101220150100.000|TR0|look-out between 2:30 and 3:30 a.m. 
20101220150100.000|20101220150102.000|TR0|Eastern time.  The show starts when the 
20101220150102.000|20101220150104.000|TR0|moon moves into the earth's shadow.
20101220150104.000|20101220150107.000|TR0|
20101220150107.000|20101220150109.000|TR0|All right.  Now, we want to push forward 
20101220150109.000|20101220150111.000|TR0|today's Talker. Millions of people who 
20101220150111.000|20101220150114.000|TR0|might be drinking water contaminated with 
20101220150114.000|20101220150116.000|TR0|a chemical that causes cancer.  The 
20101220150116.000|20101220150118.000|TR0|non-profit Environmental Working Group or 
20101220150118.000|20101220150121.000|TR0|EWG tested tap water in 35 cities.
20101220150121.000|20101220150123.000|TR0|
20101220150123.000|20101220150125.000|TR0|In 31 of them, chromium-6 was in the tap 
20101220150125.000|20101220150128.000|TR0|water.  Chromium-6, also known as the Erin 
20101220150128.000|20101220150130.000|TR0|Brockovich chemical.  This affects about 
20101220150130.000|20101220150132.000|TR0|26 million people but there could be many 
20101220150132.000|20101220150135.000|TR0|more, about three times that number. The 
20101220150135.000|20101220150137.000|TR0|EWG found that these cities had the most 
20101220150137.000|20101220150139.000|TR0|chromium-6 in the water. Norman, Oklahoma, 
20101220150139.000|20101220150142.000|TR0|Honolulu, Hawaii, Riverside and San Jose, 
20101220150142.000|20101220150144.000|TR0|California and Madison, Wisconsin.
20101220150144.000|20101220150146.000|TR0|
20101220150146.000|20101220150148.000|TR0|Now, get this.  The EPA knows this stuff 
20101220150148.000|20101220150151.000|TR0|can cause cancer, but what it's not  
20101220150151.000|20101220150153.000|TR0|making water companies is for chromium-6.  
20101220150153.000|20101220150155.000|TR0|Now, we've reached out to the EPA.  They 
20101220150155.000|20101220150158.000|TR0|should have a statement for us sometime 
20101220150158.000|20101220150200.000|TR0|today.
20101220150200.000|20101220150202.000|TR0|
20101220150202.000|20101220150205.000|TR0|Meanwhile, I've got Jane Houlihan.  She's 
20101220150205.000|20101220150207.000|TR0|with the resource director for EWG, the 
20101220150207.000|20101220150209.000|TR0|group that actually conducted this study.  
20101220150209.000|20101220150212.000|TR0|I also have the mayor of Norman, Oklahoma 
20101220150212.000|20101220150214.000|TR0|on the phone, Cindy Rosenthal. The studies 
20101220150214.000|20101220150216.000|TR0|show that her city has far the highest 
20101220150216.000|20101220150219.000|TR0|levels than any other city, but Jane, I 
20101220150219.000|20101220150221.000|TR0|want to start with you.  Why is there 
20101220150221.000|20101220150223.000|TR0|still no enforceable limit of chromium-6 
20101220150223.000|20101220150226.000|TR0|even years and years after Erin Brockovich 
20101220150226.000|20101220150228.000|TR0|exposed the dangers OF THIS?
20101220150228.000|20101220150230.000|TR0|
20101220150230.000|20101220150233.000|TR0|JANE HOULIHAN, ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING 
20101220150233.000|20101220150235.000|TR0|GROUP:  The Environmental Production 
20101220150235.000|20101220150237.000|TR0|Agency has been slow to set new safety 
20101220150237.000|20101220150239.000|TR0|standards for drinking water.  More than 
20101220150239.000|20101220150242.000|TR0|half our safety standards were set about 
20101220150242.000|20101220150244.000|TR0|20 years ago.  So with chromium-6, we 
20101220150244.000|20101220150246.000|TR0|found that it in 31 of 35 cities that we 
20101220150246.000|20101220150249.000|TR0|tested.  It's a potent carcinogen and the 
20101220150249.000|20101220150251.000|TR0|EPA does need to move forward and regulate 
20101220150251.000|20101220150253.000|TR0|this compound in drinking water.  We think 
20101220150253.000|20101220150256.000|TR0|at least 70 million Americans, are 
20101220150256.000|20101220150258.000|TR0|drinking water polluted with this 
20101220150258.000|20101220150300.000|TR0|contaminant.
20101220150300.000|20101220150303.000|TR0|
20101220150303.000|20101220150305.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:  And Mayor Rosenthal, it's your 
20101220150305.000|20101220150307.000|TR0|city that this group, that's Jane's group 
20101220150307.000|20101220150310.000|TR0|discovered has the highest level of this.  
20101220150310.000|20101220150312.000|TR0|Did you have any idea?
20101220150312.000|20101220150314.000|TR0|
20101220150314.000|20101220150317.000|TR0|MAYOR CINDY ROSENTHAL, NORMAN, OKLAHOMA 
20101220150317.000|20101220150319.000|TR0|(ON THE PHONE):  We had for years tested 
20101220150319.000|20101220150321.000|TR0|for total chromium as is required by the 
20101220150321.000|20101220150323.000|TR0|U.S. EPA and also by our Oklahoma 
20101220150323.000|20101220150326.000|TR0|Department of Environmental Quality.  That 
20101220150326.000|20101220150328.000|TR0|total chromium does include chromium 6.  
20101220150328.000|20101220150330.000|TR0|We've been in complete compliance with 
20101220150330.000|20101220150333.000|TR0|those standards and our water does meet 
20101220150333.000|20101220150335.000|TR0|all regulated standards.
20101220150335.000|20101220150337.000|TR0|
20101220150337.000|20101220150340.000|TR0|This new report, obviously, we will look 
20101220150340.000|20101220150342.000|TR0|at it and do our  due diligence to pay 
20101220150342.000|20101220150344.000|TR0|attention to its findings and we'll also 
20101220150344.000|20101220150347.000|TR0|be monitoring what the EPA says in terms 
20101220150347.000|20101220150349.000|TR0|of its evaluation, which we are told will 
20101220150349.000|20101220150351.000|TR0|be completed next year.  We're prepared to 
20101220150351.000|20101220150354.000|TR0|respond in whatever way is appropriate.
20101220150354.000|20101220150356.000|TR0|
20101220150356.000|20101220150358.000|TR0|PHILLIPS:   But that's a whole year that 
20101220150358.000|20101220150401.000|TR0|you have to wait.  So Jane, how do you 
20101220150401.000|20101220150403.000|TR0|advise the mayor with the highest levels?  
20101220150403.000|20101220150405.000|TR0|What does she do now?  What does she tell 
20101220150405.000|20101220150408.000|TR0|her folks there in Norman, Oklahoma?
20101220150408.000|20101220150410.000|TR0|
20101220150410.000|20101220150412.000|TR0|HOULIHAN:  Well, in Norman, Oklahoma, the 
20101220150412.000|20101220150414.000|TR0|levels were particularly high but we found 
20101220150414.000|20101220150417.000|TR0|this contaminant all over the country. In 
20101220150417.000|20101220150419.000|TR0|Honolulu, California, Washington, D.C..  
20101220150419.000|20101220150421.000|TR0|In Norman, Oklahoma, in particular, has 
20101220150421.000|20101220150424.000|TR0|200 times the level that the state of 
20101220150424.000|20101220150426.000|TR0|California has established as safe.  I 
20101220150426.000|20101220150428.000|TR0|would recommend doing  expediting some 
20101220150428.000|20101220150431.000|TR0|follow- up testing to get more data on 
20101220150431.000|20101220150433.000|TR0|what the levels are in that water supply 
20101220150433.000|20101220150435.000|TR0|and set some guidelines for residents.
20101220150435.000|20101220150438.000|TR0|
20101220150438.000|20101220150440.000|TR0|It's particularly important for pregnant 
20101220150440.000|20101220150442.000|TR0|women and young children to drink water 
20101220150442.000|20101220150445.000|TR0|that's safe and with levels as high as 
20101220150445.000|20101220150447.000|TR0|what we found in Norman, Oklahoma, some 
20101220150447.000|20101220150449.000|TR0|people may want to consider bottled water. 
20101220150449.000|20101220150452.000|TR0| In general, we don't recommend it because 
20101220150452.000|20101220150454.000|TR0|bottled water doesn't have to be any safer 
20101220150454.000|20101220150456.000|TR0|than tap water.  Yes, total chromium is 
20101220150456.000|20101220150459.000|TR0|regulated in tap water, but that's the 
20101220150459.000|20101220150501.000|TR0|very potent carcinogen, chromium-6, plus 
20101220150501.000|20101220150503.000|TR0|other forms of chromium that the body 
20101220150503.000|20101220150505.000|TR0|actually needs that are nutrients.
20101220150505.000|20101220150508.000|TR0|
20101220150508.000|20101220150510.000|TR0|So, that standard is 1,500 times higher 
20101220150510.000|20101220150512.000|TR0|than what's safe for chromium six itself.  
20101220150512.000|20101220150515.000|TR0|So the big step that we need nationally is 
20101220150515.000|20101220150517.000|TR0|for the Environmental Protection Agency to 
20101220150517.000|20101220150519.000|TR0|set a standard for this compound and for 
20101220150519.000|20101220150522.000|TR0|us to get  some treatment in place across 
20101220150522.000|20101220150524.000|TR0|the country to lower the levels in 
20101220150524.000|20101220150526.000|TR0|drinking water supplies.
